senses.ex: It's just a casual party, so you can wear anything you want.

Tips.title: Social Settings
Tips.description: Used when describing events or attire with a laid-back atmosphere.
Tips.example: The invite said 'casual attire', so I wore jeans.

Tips.title: Ease in Language
Tips.description: Suggests a conversational tone or simpler language that's not taken too seriously.
Tips.example: We were just having a casual chat about the weather.

senses.ex: He's a casual worker who only works when he's needed.

Tips.title: Work Flexibility
Tips.description: Refs jobs without a fixed schedule, often with varying hours or days.
Tips.example: He prefers casual work to have time for his studies.

Tips.title: Relationship Implications
Tips.description: In relationships, signifies no serious commitment or regular expectations.
Tips.example: They're in a casual relationship, nothing too serious.

senses.de: Not taking or showing deep interest
senses.ex: She has a casual interest in painting but doesn't do it seriously.

Tips.title: Level of Interest
Tips.description: Means a person has a light and non-committal interest in something.
Tips.example: I'm a casual fan; I'll watch a game if it's on.

Tips.title: Detached Stance
Tips.description: Shows a lack of deep involvement, often perceived as cool or aloof.
Tips.example: His casual dismissal of the problem surprised everyone.

senses.ex: Their meeting was casual, as they hadn't planned it.

Tips.title: Unplanned Events
Tips.description: Refers to encounters or events that happen without prior intention.
Tips.example: Our casual meeting at the cafe led to a great friendship.

senses.de: Wooden and designed only for light use
senses.ex: This is a casual chair, not meant for long-term sitting.

Tips.title: Furniture Use
Tips.description: Describing furniture suitable for temporary or occasional use.
Tips.example: We bought a casual sofa for the game room.

senses.de: A person who is employed only when needed
senses.ex: During seasonal peaks, the company hires a lot of casuals.

Tips.title: Hiring Context
Tips.description: Implies non-permanent staff hired per immediate business needs.
Tips.example: Casuals are often hired during the holiday rush.

Carefree.wordDefinition:
Carefree means without worries or responsibilities, while casual means relaxed or informal.

Carefree is applicable to a situation or person where there are no worries or responsibilities, and they are able to enjoy themselves freely.

For example, a carefree vacation is one where you can relax and not worry about work or other responsibilities.

Carefree relates to a lack of stress or responsibilities while casual relates to a relaxed atmosphere or dress code.

Complicate.wordDefinition:
Complicate means to make something more difficult or complex. For example, when you add extra steps or requirements to a task, you are complicating it.

Casual is used when talking about things that are easy-going or not overly serious, while complicate is used when talking about things that are difficult or complex.

For instance, you might use the word casual when talking about hanging out with friends or going for a walk, while complicate might be used when talking about solving a math problem or designing a complex machine.

Informal.wordDefinition:
Informal refers to a general setting or situation that is relaxed and not overly formal. This can include things like a casual get-together with friends or a relaxed work environment.

The main difference is that casual specifically refers to clothing, while informal refers to the overall atmosphere or setting.

Nonchalant.wordDefinition:
Casual means relaxed and informal in style, behavior, or attitude while nonchalant means appearing coolly unconcerned or indifferent.

Casual can be applied to clothing, conversation, and behavior in a laid-back setting while nonchalant is more appropriate when describing someone's attitude or demeanor towards a situation, often in a situation where other people may be worried or stressed.

Pretentious.wordDefinition:
Casual means relaxed, informal and comfortable, whereas pretentious means trying to seem more important or impressive than one actually is.

Casual would be applicable in social situations where one doesn't need to be too formal or serious, while pretentious would be applicable when someone is trying too hard to impress others or seem more sophisticated than they really are.

For example, wearing a T-shirt and jeans to a casual get-together with friends would be appropriate, but wearing a tuxedo and talking in a fake accent to seem sophisticated would be pretentious.

Relax.wordDefinition:
Casual usually means that you are dressed in a way that is comfortable but not too formal, and can describe a relaxed atmosphere or mood.

Relax implies a state of being calm or free from stress, and can apply to physical and mental aspects.

Casual refers to external factors related to appearance or surroundings, while relax refers to an internal state of being calm and stress-free.

Restrain.wordDefinition:
Restrain means to hold back, prevent, or control something or someone.

It can be applied to physical or emotional restraints. For example, a police officer may restrain a criminal, while a person may restrain their emotions during a difficult conversation.

Casual refers to being relaxed and informal, while restrain refers to holding back or controlling something or someone.

Undemanding.wordDefinition:
Undemanding means something that is not difficult or challenging. It is applicable in situations where you need to do something that is easy for you to achieve without much effort or skill.

For example, a task may be undemanding if it requires only basic understanding or physical ability to complete.

Casual is about the atmosphere or mindset, while undemanding is about the level of difficulty or challenge involved in a task.

Originally invented in the late 19th century, these simple canvas and rubber creations have changed a lot since they first hit the pavement. Today, sneaker consumption is at an all-time high.

In her entire four month tenure, her sharp wits and stealth never failed her.

videos.Text: For some, it's a serious sport. For others, just a way to let loose. But despite its casual association with fun and sun, surfing has a richer and deeper history than many realize.

quotes.Text: Let's put it this way: I don't have a good work ethic. I have a real casual relationship with hours. I don't understand why, in entertainment, the hours are as long as they are. It seems like everything takes forever, and no one can tell you why, exactly.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Janeane Garofalo

quotes.Text: I spend most of my life in sports kit, so it usually shocks people when they see me in casual clothing - let alone dressed up with make-up on. I've walked past people from my own family who don't recognise me.
quotes.Title: British Athlete
quotes.Name: Johanna Konta

quotes.Text: I believe in taking big risks. If you encourage new people, they want to prove themselves. They give their best. This is not possible with established stars, who treat their job casually most of the time.
quotes.Title: Indian Director
quotes.Name: Pooja Bhatt

quotes.Text: All of the most important lessons about writing I learned from my father. He never set out to teach me anything, it would just be something he said casually in conversation.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Joss Whedon

quotes.Text: We thought sex was free. Sex is not free. There's a price to be paid emotionally, physically, even legally. Sex isn't a casual thing. It's a huge thing.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: William H. Macy

quotes.Text: I would hope there would be a greater appreciation by casual sports fans of the incredible skill and passion of our players.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Gary Bettman

quotes.Text: We want to create a kind of cycle where casual gamers are gradually growing up to become passionate players.
quotes.Title: Japanese Businessman
quotes.Name: Satoru Iwata

quotes.Text: I like a movie that the audience actively has to participate in and not just casually observe.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Jennifer Jason Leigh

quotes.Text: I look like a casual, laid-back guy, but it's like a circus in my head.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Steven Wright

quotes.Text: The casual listener won't be around forever.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mike Shinoda
